newsitem.title: UK: UK National Power plans regional venture - paper.
newsitem.headline: UK National Power plans regional venture - paper.

text.p: Britain's National Power Plc is in talks with three regional electricity companies (RECs) and a supermarket chain to create a combined electricity supply business, The Independent newspaper said on Thursday.
It quoted National Power's chief executive, Keith Henry, as saying he expected a deal to be signed by next spring, before the electricity market is opened up to competition in 1998.
A deal could involve the generator taking an equity stake in the supply company or agreeing a long-term alliance to sell electricity to the venture, the Independent said.
